Class.name: fulltext.search.v1.Data
Class.Description:
This sample class shows a free-text search feature, implemented based on the %Library.FunctionalIndex capability of Cach√©. The class has a %Library.String type property (pDescription) with a custom functional index defined on that field.

To test the index, first populate the data either by inserting new rows into the table on your favourite way (object or SQL), or use the built-in, automatic data population option:

Do ##class(fulltext.search.v1.Data).Populate(numberOfRecords)

Then you can use the following SQL query:

SELECT ID, Description FROM fulltext_search_v1.Data WHERE ID %INSET search_index(DescIdx, '')

Index.name: DescIdx
Index.Description: Custom index specification. For deatils: see the <class>fulltext.search.v1.Index</class> functional index class.

Property.name: Company
Property.Description: Automatic population of the Company field is done by the Company method in %Library.PopulateUtils.

Property.name: Description
Property.Description: Automatic population of the Description field is done by the Mission method in %Library.PopulateUtils.
